name: places/ChIJGdHXyJZZwokR16nL1NA7PRs
formattedAddress: 484 2nd Ave 2nd Floor, New York, NY 10016, USA
adrFormatAddress: 484 2nd Ave 2nd Floor, New York, NY 10016, USA

originalText.text:
My son went here for 2 years and absolutely loved it. The teachers are energetic, kind and caring. Craig is fantastic at not only running the school but also be apart of the children's daily activities.
The school heavily emphasized on the importance of art and music. My son was always painting, singing, dancing and using his imagination. I have nothing but good things to say about their curriculum.
The school is fun, bright and clean. The best part is the private outdoor play area. We've since moved away, but often think about Rosehill a lot. Thank you for being such a big part of my son's early education.

originalText.text:
A beautiful, warm, loving, creative schoolüåπ

Our family came to Manhattan for a three months work trip, and we had to enroll our three years old daughter Layan into a pre-school for this period, and among few schools that we looked into, we decided to go with Rose Hill Montessori and we are very glad that we did.

Our daughter kept wanting to go to school every day, even when she was sick and couldn't go.

She never had a problem going to school, and she always wanted to stay more at school.

The school has limitless creative projects, and because she is interested in colors, water, and music, she found activities that fulfilled her cravings and much more.

They have two safe outdoor spaces for the kids to run around, play, and explore.

The indoor space is very cozy and divided into themes and activity sections.

If you are looking for a school that is safe, creative, and loving, look no further.

Now, as we are back home after the trip, it will be a challenge to find a school that can provide the same level of dedication.

Thank you, Rose Hill Montessori üåπ for the blissful experience you provided our daughter with. We wish you all the best ‚ù§Ô∏è

originalText.text: Our son had been in Rose Hill for 2 month and he adopted to the school so fast that after the 3rd day he did not want to come home. All the teachers are so hands on and the activities are very well planed. Painting, music, book reading, outdoor activities, with all creative touches that kids need. Teachers are all so accommodating/organized, and are always there to help if we need anything. The outdoor spaces are amazing. The cleanliness is very impressive. Finally, the pictures and videos that they post definitely are helpful to put parents mind at ease. Thank you Craig for such a thoughtful and well designed institution!!

originalText.text:
Our kid loves the school. We send him to another school when we need back up care. He went to a third school for summer camp, also a Montessori. But hands down, our kid is the happiest at Rose hill. I‚Äôm not surprised because the teachers are so warm and affectionate, and put a lot of thought in planning daily science/art/cultural activities. They also give us a one on one update a few times a week. Craig, the headmaster, is wonderful and always so flexible.
Bonus: 2 private outdoor spaces within the school campus. This is what attracted us to rose hill in the first place. The classrooms are dreamy - very well lit, walls embellished with DIY artwork by kids, and lots of earthy natural elements all around.

originalText.text: We have had a great experience at Rose Hill Montessori!  I love that they take pictures throughout the day and share them within the app.  My son has had some great teachers, and the directors have setup a great program that allows for flexibility for our family‚Äôs needs.
